event.title: stands no more than two days

data.event: Water stands no more than two days in a rain garden because a mixture of organic material and/or sand is added to allow drainage.

event.title: visited Kit Carson Elementary on Wednesday

data.event: Scott Darst, Madison County extension agent for youth development, visited Kit Carson Elementary on Wednesday to help club members conduct a soil percolation test, to determine how their rain garden’s soil should be treated to ensure drainage.

event.title: do not hatch for seven days

data.event: “Mosquitoes will lay eggs in the water, but the eggs do not hatch for seven days.

event.title: the rain garden pools drain in two days

data.event: Because the rain garden pools drain in two days, the mosquito eggs die.

event.title: will plant their garden on Earth Day

data.event: The students will plant their garden on Earth Day, April 22.
The school’s ecology club, which started three years ago with eight members, today includes more than 75 students from third through fifth grades.
The school’s ecology club, which started three years ago with eight members, today includes more than 75 students from third through fifth grades.
To help fulfill its grant obligations to the rain garden alliance, Kit Carson Elementary will conduct an April 18 rain garden workshop for teachers and other adults.

event.title: send an e-mail to Brittany Zwicker by Friday

data.event: To register, send an e-mail to Brittany Zwicker by Friday at brittany@kentuckypride.com with attendee’s name, lunch preference, school name/organization and subjects taught.
